issue.title: Pull request for #515

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
This is for issue #515
- @todo #115:1hr Implement the Git Data Tags API. We need to
  -  implement the following:
  -  1) Add the operations in http://developer.github.com/v3/git/tags/
  -  to the Tags interface.
  -  2) A class RtTags, which performs RESTful request operations
  -  against the Tags API.
  -  3) A class MkTags, which mocks the Tags interface.
  -  4) An interface Tag, which represents a single Tag of the
  -  Git Data API.
  -  5) RtTags, a Tag implementation which fetches and modifies
  -  Tag information according to the Tags API, and
  -  6) MkTag, which mocks a single Reference object.
  -  Don't forget to implement unit tests and integration tests.

issue.title: Rultor cannot merge code due to RtDeployKeysITCase error

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
In a few of the recent attempts by Rultor to merge the code, `RtDeployKeysITCase` returned an error that was similar to this:

```
Results :

Failed tests:
  RtDeployKeysITCase.getsDeployKey:114 HTTP response status is not equal to 201:
422 Unprocessable Entity [https://api.github.com/repos/jcabi-github-test/test/keys]
Server: GitHub.com
...
{"message":"Validation Failed","documentation_url":"http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/keys/#create","errors":[{"resource":"PublicKey","code":"custom","field":"key","message":"key is already in use"}]}
```

This is preventing us from merging any new code into the repo. We may need to clean up the deploy keys in `jcabi-github-test/test` repo, at least in the short term. A long term fix would entail some set up code that will try to check and clean up the deploy keys for each execution of the integration test.

issue.title: Issue #557 Content can now be obtained in raw and encoded form

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.title: Content should have method to get content value

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
According to API doc http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-contents
`Content` should have method to actually get encoded content value (if content is file).
There are two options:
1) Provide method `Contents.raw()`
2) Or  `Content.content()`

As for me, both methods can return `String`

This issue may block #524, because there is no way to check that content was actually updated

issue.title: Contents.update() may return Commit

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
According to API doc http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#update-a-file
in response to `update` operation server returns `commit` and `content`. In our code `Contents.update()` returns nothing.
Logically would be to return `Content`, but in this case we lose commit. Moreover, we have no key to fetch this commit on next step.
From this point of view, it would be better to return `Commit` as a result of update.

Other option - return some wrapper for `Commit` and `Content`

This issue may block #524
The same problem for `create` operation - no way to get associated `Commit`

body: I created a new pull request for this https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/pull/616. @yegor256 please review, this is blocking most of our tasks from completing.

@longtimeago we've merged a fix for this, are you satisfied it?

@yegor256 @dmarkov this ticket was labeled as assigned to me, but there's no time budget. I suppose it's 30 minutes as is our standard?
let's leave it open until it's paid
